0767d6a1ace4f6eb84366d88aa35dde8 (02:38): I am trying to validate my css and I am getting a warning that it does not like the background-color : transparent; in my css. I am searching through google but there haven't ben any acceptable answers and the w3c page says background-color : transparent; should work. Since it doesn't like transparent what can I use?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (02:38): or the div, even
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (02:38): Understudy: it's a warning, not an error
0767d6a1ace4f6eb84366d88aa35dde8 (02:39): reisio, yes but I was hoping there was a way to get rid of the warning?

9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (02:39): all it's saying is "there are idiots out there that use odd default colors, and if you haven't thought about it, you might end up making the background color the same color as their text color"
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (02:39): oh sure there's a way
0767d6a1ace4f6eb84366d88aa35dde8 (02:40): reisio, what is bad is my background for the body is an image
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (02:40): well, backgroun-color goes below background-image
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (02:40): background-color*

78d029a178c75db05a1ca3e795507229 (02:40): reisio: Sorry, I don't follow what you mean by "around"?  Is this error because I put the modified-to-be-valid google site search form within <div class="content_box_large">?
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (02:40): Anbidian: you can't put form inside p
78d029a178c75db05a1ca3e795507229 (02:41): reisio: Oh :| I see.  It validated fine when I had it outside the form.  Is there any way to get it in there? I found it looked least ugly inside there.
78d029a178c75db05a1ca3e795507229 (02:41): *outside the <div class
9621eb291fb98ba098685ed872b8cf9a (02:42): just taking it outside of the p should be enough
78d029a178c75db05a1ca3e795507229 (02:45): Thanks.  I'll modify it now and see.
